answerText: : chemical potential [prompt on potential][10] For an ideal free gas of electrons, the chemical potential is the Fermi energy at this temperature.  This temperature is equal to zero kelvin.
heading: 2010 ACF Fall |2010 | Bellarmine and UCLA (1) | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The gradient of this quantity acts as the driving force in diffusion.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity, often symbolized mu, that, for a component in solution, is equal to the derivative of total internal energy with respect to number of particles of the component.
